      23                 :            : namespace rtps{
      24                 :            : 
      25                 :            : 
      26                 :            : /**
      27                 :            :  * Interface against which to implement a transport layer, decoupled from FastRTPS internals.
      28                 :            :  * TransportInterface expects the user to implement a logical equivalence between Locators and protocol-specific "channels".
      29                 :            :  * This equivalence can be narrowing: For instance in UDP/IP, a port would take the role of channel, and several different
      30                 :            :  * locators can map to the same port, and hence the same channel. 
      31                 :            :  * @ingroup TRANSPORT_MODULE
      32                 :            :  * */
      33                 :            : class TransportInterface
      34                 :            : {
      35                 :            : public:
      36                 :            : 
      37                 :            :    /**
      38                 :            :     * Aside from the API defined here, an user-defined Transport must define a descriptor data type and a constructor that
      39                 :            :     * expects a constant reference to such descriptor. e.g:
      40                 :            :     *
      41                 :            :     * class MyTransport:
      42                 :            :     * public:
      43                 :            :     *    typedef struct { ... } MyTransportDescriptor;
      44                 :            :     *    MyTransport(const MyTransportDescriptor&);
      45                 :            :     *    ...
      46                 :            :     */
      47                 :          0 :    virtual ~TransportInterface(){};
      48                 :            : 
      49                 :            :    virtual bool init() = 0;
      50                 :            : 
      51                 :            :    /**
      52                 :            :     * Must report whether the output channel associated to this locator is open. Channels must either be 
      53                 :            :     * fully closed or fully open, so that "open" and "close" operations are whole and definitive.
      54                 :            :     */
      55                 :            :    virtual bool IsOutputChannelOpen(const Locator_t&) const = 0;
      56                 :            : 
      57                 :            :    /**
      58                 :            :     * Must report whether the input channel associated to this locator is open. Channels must either be 
      59                 :            :     * fully closed or fully open, so that "open" and "close" operations are whole and definitive.
      60                 :            :     */
      61                 :            :    virtual bool IsInputChannelOpen(const Locator_t&) const = 0;
      62                 :            : 
      63                 :            :    //! Must report whether the given locator is supported by this transport (typically inspecting its "kind" value).
      64                 :            :    virtual bool IsLocatorSupported(const Locator_t&) const = 0;
      65                 :            : 
      66                 :            :    //! Returns the locator describing the main (most general) channel that can write to the provided remote locator.
      67                 :            :    virtual Locator_t RemoteToMainLocal(const Locator_t& remote) const = 0;
      68                 :            : 
      69                 :            :    //! Must open the channel that maps to/from the given locator. This method must allocate, reserve and mark
      70                 :            :    //! any resources that are needed for said channel.
      71                 :            :    virtual bool OpenOutputChannel(Locator_t&) = 0;
      72                 :            :    virtual bool OpenInputChannel(const Locator_t&) = 0;
      73                 :            : 
      74                 :            :    /**
      75                 :            :     * Must close the channel that maps to/from the given locator. 
      76                 :            :     * IMPORTANT: It MUST be safe to call this method even during a Send operation on another thread. You must implement
      77                 :            :     * any necessary mutual exclusion and timeout mechanisms to make sure the channel can be closed without damage.
      78                 :            :     */
      79                 :            :    virtual bool CloseOutputChannel(const Locator_t&) = 0;
      80                 :            :    /**
      81                 :            :     * Must close the channel that maps to/from the given locator. 
      82                 :            :     * IMPORTANT: It MUST be safe to call this method even during a Receive operation on another thread. You must implement
      83                 :            :     * any necessary mutual exclusion and timeout mechanisms to make sure the channel can be closed without damage.
      84                 :            :     */
      85                 :            :    virtual bool CloseInputChannel(const Locator_t&) = 0;
      86                 :            : 
      87                 :            :    //! Must report whether two locators map to the same internal channel.
      88                 :            :    virtual bool DoLocatorsMatch(const Locator_t&, const Locator_t&) const = 0;
      89                 :            :   /**
      90                 :            :    * Must execute a blocking send, through the outbound channel that maps to the localLocator, targeted to the
      91                 :            :    * remote address defined by remoteLocator. Must be threadsafe between channels, but not necessarily
      92                 :            :    * within the same channel.
      93                 :            :    */
      94                 :            :    virtual bool Send(const octet* sendBuffer, uint32_t sendBufferSize, const Locator_t& localLocator, const Locator_t& remoteLocator) = 0;
      95                 :            : 
      96                 :            :    /**
      97                 :            :     * Must execute a blocking receive, on the inbound channel that maps to the localLocator, receiving from the
      98                 :            :     * address that gets written to remoteLocator. Must be threadsafe between channels, but not necessarily
      99                 :            :     * within the same channel.
     100                 :            :     */
     101                 :            :    virtual bool Receive(octet* receiveBuffer, uint32_t receiveBufferCapacity, uint32_t& receiveBufferSize,
     102                 :            :                         const Locator_t& localLocator, Locator_t& remoteLocator) = 0;
     103                 :            :

     105                 :            :

     107                 :            : 
     108                 :            :    virtual bool is_local_locator(const Locator_t& locator) const = 0;
